answers.answer: Doesn't sound like an emergency but you should def let your dr know. I had to sit down a lot wgen making dinner in my later trimester with my first baby. Make sure you are drinking enough water and getting enough rest!! And of course eating healthy.
Are u anemic? I felt the same way and when I went to the doctor, she told me I was anemic. She gave me iron pills nd I've felt perfectly fine since.
It could either be anemia or preeclampsia.

My doctor told me standing or sitting 90 degrees for long periods is what was causing my dizzy spells. Both positions don't allow for good blood flow. She told me to wear ted hose at work to keep the blood out of my legs and up higher where it should be and to make sure I lean back slightly while sitting. I also found out I am anemic which probably didn't help.
And just because you weren't anemic before you were pregnant, doesn't rule out the possibility that you could be now. Pregnancy makes your whole body change, either for the better or for the worse.

I understand I ment that I get tested for anemia every other visit and last visit was 2 weeks ago.I eat healthy and make sure to take my prenatals. I also drink water all day so... it just baffles me. The only thing I could think of is my baby's possition
I was just about to post a question on this. I feel like I just took tequila shots, and am goin to fall asleep. I'm glad I found your question.
I feel the same I actually fainted. My doc told me all bw was great that it was just the increase of blood flow.

Dizziness is really common during pregnancy. Unless it happens multiple times in a day you shouldn't really worry. I was literally standing when i felt like that and i started to walk outside to get some fresh air and i passed out while walking i told my doctor about it and he said it was normal I've felt like that many other times but that was the only time i just passed out.
All the research I've done suggests it's normal. I guess we will just have to wait it out

question: So for the last week or so I've been experiencing weird dizzy spells, but they even happen when I am sitting down. Its not like the room is spinning... more like when ur tipsy and just beginning to feel the buzz. But it's happening more frequent and stronger. Yesterday I was making dinner and i had to sit down because I felt like I was going to pass out. And after I ate it happened again. At first this is what happens... it feels like someone pushes on my throat and shuts off blood to my head. Then I am obviously light headed. It lasts forever it seems. I am NOT diabetic or have prego diabetes.  Is it possible that my baby is lying on a vein or something? Is this an emergency?
title: 32 weeks and WHAT IS THIS?
